comments:
In the 'Source Folder Selection' dialog press the 'Create new Folder..' and
'Advanced' to create a folder linked to an external location.

When trying to insert a break point into a java file in the external folder I
got an error message.  Moving the java files to the normal source directory and
compiling allowed me to use a break point.

The exception below looks like it was trying to find the files in
project/jsp_source where as they are in project/linked folder/jsp_source

Here is the exception from the eclipse log file:

!SESSION Aug 11, 2003 18:07:55.113 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.3.1_08
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data e:\program
files\eclipse-data -install file:E:/program files/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 120 Aug 11, 2003 18:07:55.113
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug UI: 
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: The archive: /project20/jsp_servlet
which is referenced by the classpath, does not exist.
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.abort(JavaRuntime.java:1072)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.abort(JavaRuntime.java:1058)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.resolveRuntimeClasspathEntry(JavaRuntime.java:730)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.StandardSourcePathProvider.resolveClasspath(StandardSourcePathProvider.java:56)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.resolveSourceLookupPath(JavaRuntime.java:619)

	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.initializeSourceLocator(LaunchConfiguration.java:183)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:155)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:735)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools.buildAndLaunch(DebugUITools.java:550)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools$2.run(DebugUITools.java:499)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:101)

The log is not related to breakpoints. The log entry shows that a jar on your 
classpath does not exist anymore. Do you have explicit steps to reproduce the 
breakpoint problem?

Adding a breakpoint to a java file in a linked folder works for me in build 
I20030910.

traces.message: The archive: /project20/jsp_servlet which is referenced by the classpath, does not exist.
